Here's a little ditty for your sleepy kitty Lucy:

(Sung to a gentle, soothing melody)

"Lucy, oh Lucy, sweetest of dreams,
Purring softly, curled up in seams.

Your whiskers twitch, your ears fold tight,
As you snooze the day away, shining bright.

Your whiskers twitch, your ears fold tight,
As you chase the sunbeams, shining bright.

In slumber deep, you find your peace,
Where moonlight whispers secrets, release.

In slumber, you find your happy place,
Where mice and feathers fill your face.

In slumber, you roam free and wide,
Hunting moonbeams, with a gentle stride.

In slumber's grasp, you gently sway,
A furry ball of fur, soft and gray.

In slumber's embrace, you're snug as can be,
Your little heart beats slow and carefree.

In slumber deep, you reign supreme,
Your little nose twitches, your paws serene.

The world outside may be loud and wide,
But in your sleep,'t thou shall reside.

So snuggle in, your cozy bed,
And let your dreams take gentle flight ahead.

So rest on, dear Lucy,'t you fear,
For in your dreams, joy is always near.

So rest now, dear one,'t worry or fear,
For when you wake, treats await thee here.

And I'll be waiting, by thy side,
To give thee scratches, and snuggles inside."

Sweet Lucy,'t thy peaceful heart delight,
In dreams of mice and feathers, soft and bright."

And though thy snores may shake the air,
We'll love thee just the same,'t care."

And though thy day be filled with play,
Right now,'t sleep,'t best of all the way."

And though you sleep, your beauty shines so bright,
Our lovely Lucy,'t our hearts delight."

And though the world may spin with glee,
In dreamland, Lucy, sweet kitty, you'll be."

And though we wait, your lazy days,
We'll love thee just the same, in all thy ways."

And though the world may spin with glee,
In thy dreams, Lucy, sweet harmony."

Till then, just dream of mice and play,
And know you're loved, every single day."

And we'll cuddle close,'and whisper low,
'I love you, Lucy, sleepy kitty glow.'"
